content: width length the carmen balaclava @paula on knits about the carmen balaclava is knit from top to bottom starting flat and then transitioning to the round the first section is a rectangular top from which the main body of the balaclava is shaped the sample shown is knit using drops daisy in red combined with drops kid silk in red for a softer finish you can watch my video tutorial linked below and knit along with me it includes all the steps of this project materials gauge 2 skeins of 50g/110m yarn 10x10 cm 13 stitches by 19 row on 8mm 8mm circular needles 80-100cm needles in stockinette 1 sm to mark your beginning of the round tapestry needle to weave in your ends video tutorial measurements one size length - 41cm / 16 14 inch the carmen balaclava video tutorial width - 24cm / 9 45 inch instructions cast on 20 stitches sts and work in stockinette until the piece measures 16 cm next cut the yarn and pick up 20 sts along one lateral side of your rectangular piece start picking them up from the from the first st you casted on and continue towards the last row you had in progress knit across the 20 sts you had already on your needles and then pick up 20 sts along the other lateral side you should now have 60 sts on your needles and the piece will form a u shape continue working in stockinette until the piece measures 30 cm from the top cast on an additional 10 sts at the end of the row bringing the total to 70 sts join in the round place a stitch marker sm and work 3 rounds in stockinette now shape the neckline by starting the next round with k1 p1 and continue working in ribbing until the piece measures 41 cm or your desired length then cast off in pattern to finish the face opening pick up sts evenly around the edge and place a sm to indicate the beginning of the round work 8 rounds in stockinette fold the brim inward and use a kitchener stitch to join the cast-off row with the first picked-up sts you are done feel free to take a pic and tag @paula on knits using #carmenbalaclava © the content on this knitting pattern is owned by @paula on knits and is protected by copyright it is intended for personal non-commercial use only you may not reproduce distribute or sell this pattern whether in its entirety or in part as well as any items crafted using this pattern
